text.content: A NEW HAIRCUT
Kevin wanted a fresh look.
He was about to start his last year of high school in the barrio, and he didn’t want to look like a kid anymore.
His current haircut was simple—short and neat.
He had it since he was 13.
But now, he wanted something bold, something that would make people take him seriously.
He walked into the local barbershop, where the sound of clippers and loud music filled the air.
"What are you looking for?" the barber asked, adjusting his razor.
Kevin hesitated.
"I want something different, something that makes me look like a leader."
The barber smirked.
"Say no more."
He started shaping Kevin’s hair, adding sharp lines and a fade.
Kevin sat still, trusting the barber’s skill.
He couldn’t see himself in the mirror because his glasses were off, but he could feel the difference.
When the barber finished, Kevin put on his glasses and looked at himself.
He barely recognized his reflection.
He looked older, tougher.
His friends were shocked when they saw him.
"Damn, bro, you look like a reggaeton star!" one of them said.
Even strangers at school noticed him.
A few days later, a local music producer approached him at the mall.
"Ever thought about modeling for a music video?"
Kevin laughed, but he took the guy’s number.
Maybe this haircut really was the start of something new.
